News & Media Member Login REGISTER HERE Give Search for: Contact 2025-08-25T10:48:20-06:00 Contact Us Lakeland Hills YMCA is community-centered, bringing people of all ages and backgrounds together, to nurture potential and mobilize local communities to effect lasting and meaningful change. We look forward to helping you with your needs and answering any questions you may have. Feel free to contact us via the form below or through a membership representative at one of our local YMCAs. Contact Us Form √ó Contact Lakeland Hills Family Y Name * First Last Email * Who do you want to contact? * President and Chief Executive Officer, Alex Martinez Fund Development Associate, Dante Gonzalez Health & Wellness Director, Kelly Najjar Assistant Camp and Program Director, Quentin Pickering Camp & Youth Program Director, Linnea Berry Website Manager, Carmen Fritsch HR Director, Renee Dorn Chief Operating Officer, Devon Maloney Assistant Aquatics Director & Swim Lesson Coordinator, Yash Kothari Controller, Gail Shelby Fitness Director, Gerry Gessie Member Services Coordinator, Hope Hornick IT Director, Jonathan Ogintz Aquatics Manager/Lifeguard Coordinator, Sydney Jasinski Vice President Fund Development, Kaite Burke Community Engagement Manager, Kelly Horvath Early Childhood Learning Center Director, Michele Leaman Buildings and Grounds Assistant Director, Mika Newman Buildings and Grounds Director, Mike Ambrosi Membership Administrator/Day Camp Bookkeeper, Nancy Dunham Member Services Director, Rene√© Welch Vice President Marketing and Membership, Rosemary Linder Day Competitive Swim Team & HR Administrator, Sarah Gulbin Senior Program Director, Shannon Bujoreanu Chief Financial Officer, Robert Marzan Early Childhood Learning Center Program Specialist & I-SWAP Manager, Cynthia Rodriguez Message * CAPTCHA Phone This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. Œî Close Lakeland Hills Family YMCA 100 Fanny Road Mountain Lakes, NJ Phone: 973-334-2820 membership@lhymca.com Frequently Asked Questions What are your facility hours? Our hours are: Monday ‚Äì Friday 5:00 A.M ‚Äì 10:30 P.M. Saturday ‚Äì Sunday 7:00 A.M. ‚Äì 6:00 P.M. Directions Can I access other YMCA‚Äôs with my Lakeland Hills YMCA membership? Yes. We are proud to offer our members access to YMCA facilities across the United States and Canada that participate in Nationwide Membership. This way, our members can use the Y as often as they like, making it easier to achieve their health and wellness goals. Are group exercise classes available? Yes. We have over 65 weekly classes offered from Yoga to HIT. These classes offer a great workout in a class setting, and are all included with your membership. Can I bring a friend? Yes. As a member, you are given 3 guest passes per year. You can bring a friend up to 3X for free. After that there is a fee. Guests/friends can use facility a max of 3X per year and then must become a member. Is there a trial membership to try out the Y? Yes. We have a 1-Week Trial Membership for free.¬† After that, we have several options that you can choose as a new member. What benefits do I get with my membership? Full Privilege Membership entitles you to use the pool, basketball gymnasium, Health and Fitness Training Center, general membership locker rooms, as well as group fitness, yoga, spinning classes, and all aqua exercise classes. Plus, three free guest passes per year and a fitness orientation. Some age restrictions apply. Long Term Locker Membership offers full privilege membership plus an assigned locker and towel service in an adult only locker room which includes steam room, sauna and TV. What are the pool hours? For Pool Hours and available swim times, please visit our schedules page where you can download swim times as well as gymnasium and group fitness class times. Do you offer financial assistance? Yes. We offer financial aid to ensure that no one is turned away from a Y program or service due to an inability to pay. Visit our Financial Assistance page for more information. STAY CURIOUS Want to know more about how you can make an impact in the community? Fill out this simple form to learn how to get involved. About Us Join Give Volunteer Test Contact Leadership Team Register Privacy Policy Member Login Facility Hours Y Hours Mon-Fri: 5:00am-10:15pm Sat-Sun: 7:00am ‚Äì 5:45pm Desk Hours Mon-Fri: 8:00am-8:00pm Sat-Sun: 8:00am ‚Äì 4:00pm Learn more >> CONNECT WITH US Copyright ¬© Lakeland Hills YMCA Lakeland Hills YMCA | 100 Fanny Road | Mountain Lakes, NJ 07046 | 973.334.2820 Site designed by Daxko Toggle Sliding Bar Area Page load link Both Tai Chi classes will be cancelled Thursday, September 11. Last chance this week to register for fall classes, which begin Monday, September 8. Registration available 24/7 online. + +

PigFest TN | BBQ Competition & Concert Hendersonville, TN 615-822-3898 pigfesttn@gmail.com Home Competitors Sponsors Vendors Past Results Community Partners Media Become A Judge Select Page DATE OCTOBER 23 ‚Äì OCTOBER 25, 2025 LOCATION 140 SCOTCH STREET, VETERANS PARK HENDERSONVILLE, TN 37075 Three Great Days, More Great Causes, All in Hendersonville, TN! THURSDAY, OCT 23rd Steak Dinner | Silent Auction Trivia | Parking Palette BUY TICKETS HERE! THURSDAY, OCT 23rd Jeff Jarrett, ‚ÄúThe Last Outlaw‚Äù All-Star Super Slam! BUY TICKETS HERE! FRIDAY, OCTOBER 24th Hendersonville Hometown Jam Kick-off Concert! BUY TICKETS HERE! SATURDAY, OCT 25th BBQ Competition | College Football KidzZone | Pig Races & more‚Ä¶ FREE TO ATTEND The Countdown Has Begun to Pigfest 2025! Day(s) : Hour(s) : Minute(s) : Second(s) About The Event The 5th Annual Hendersonville Pig Fest returns to Veterans Park October 23‚Äì25, 2025! This three-day celebration brings the community together to support local charities with nonstop fun for the whole family. Enjoy an ALL-STAR Wrestling Match , the Hendersonville Hometown Jam Friday Night Concert , and Saturday‚Äôs sizzling Backyard BBQ Competition . Plus, don‚Äôt miss food trucks, local vendors, live music, pig races, kidz zone fun, and even The Parking Palette community painting project. Mark your calendars for October 23‚Äì25, 2025 ‚Äîyou don‚Äôt want to miss Hendersonville‚Äôs biggest backyard party! Thursday Night ALL-STAR SUPER SLAM with Jeff Jarrett! üî•Get ready to RUMBLE, Hendersonville!üî• Grab your crew and join us on Thursday, October 23rd, for an action-packed night of body slams when Double J ‚ÄúThe Last Outlaw‚Äù Hall of Famer ‚Äì Jeff Jarrett comes home to Hendersonville and brings his All Star Super Slam with him! And, for the first time in his career, he will be in the wrestling rink at PigFest! Tickets go on sale Friday, August 22nd, at 10:00 AM! GET YOUR TICKETS HERE! Steak Dinner, Trivia & Parking Palette üî•Bring Your Appetite, Your Smartest Friends, and Your Imagination!üî• Get ready for the first unforgettable evening of PigFest 2025 happening at Veterans‚Äô Park on Thursday, October 23rd! Join us for a fantastic night filled with trivia, delicious steaks, and amazing giveaways from our generous sponsors. Plus, don‚Äôt miss the chance to make your mark on this year‚Äôs Parking Palette, courtesy of Servpro Sumner County ! We‚Äôre thrilled to have ExS Group (Exterior Solutions Group ‚Äì Pool Leak Detection and Repair), Candee Potter , One Stop Realty , Main Street Pub , Tailgate Nashville , and Pub Peril partnering with us to bring you a spectacular night of fun, food, and fabulous prizes! All proceeds from this exciting night will benefit local non-profit organizations, Live Love Nashville , Grace Place , Christmas 4Kids , and Mary‚Äôs Magical Place . PARKING PALETTE DETAILS: Event Guidelines: ‚Äì You can repaint or refresh your parking spots anytime within a year after the event. ‚Äì Assigned parking spots do not come with special parking privileges. ‚Äì Artists must leave about a four-inch unpainted border between the white parking lines and their artwork. ‚Äì All designs must be approved by the Parks Department. ‚Äì Supplies are generously provided by SERVPRO Sumner County. ‚Äì PROHIBITED PAINTS: Please refrain from using oil-based paints, reflective paint, spray paint, fluorescent paint, paint sprayers, or clear coats. Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible night at PigFest ‚Äî mark your calendars! TIME: 5:30-10:00 PM PURCHASE TICKETS THIS YEAR‚ÄôS CHARITY BENEFICIARIES HENDERSONVILLE HOMETOWN JAM CONCERT LIVE with Country Music Royalty The Oak Ridge Boys! FRIDAY NIGHT, OCTOBER 24, 2025 | GATES OPEN AT 5:00 PM PigFest 2025 kicks off with a legendary BANG! as The Oak Ridge Boys take the stage! With decades of chart-topping hits, Grammy-winning harmonies, and unforgettable energy, these icons are bringing their signature sound to Hendersonville, TN‚Äôs PigFest for an epic night of music and memories. From ‚ÄúElvira‚Äù to ‚ÄúAmerican Made,‚Äù their timeless classics have been the soundtrack of generations‚Äîand now, they‚Äôre headlining the PigFest 2025 Kickoff Concert ! Whether you‚Äôre a lifelong fan or discovering their magic for the first time, get ready for a night filled with foot-stompin‚Äô, hand-clappin‚Äô, soul-liftin‚Äô country goodness. The legends are live. The crowd will be electric. The memories‚Ä¶Unforgettable! Don‚Äôt miss The Oak Ridge Boys at PigFest 2025. Get Your Tickets Now! PURCHASE TICKETS Friday Night Music Continues With More Dynamic Performers! Exile Eric Blankenship DINKVILLE PICKLE N‚Äô PIG CHARITY PICKLEBALL TOURNAMENT Saturday, October 25th & Sunday, October 26th Drinks Dinner Concert BBQ Competition For more information or to register a booth for the Backyard BBQ Competition, click the button underneath. SPACE IS LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY! Register Here Become a Vendor For more information or to register a booth for an opportunity to become a vendor at PigFest, click the button underneath. Frequently Asked Questions About Pigfest 1. How Do I Get to Pigfest? 4175 Medulla Rd Lakeland, FL 33811 Phone: 863-644-2431 I-4 East ‚Äì Exit 22 South Continue South on Park Rd. At third light, turn East (left) on Coronet Rd. Follow Coronet, turn East (left) on Medulla Rd. At the light turn South (right) on County Line Rd. and then East (left) on W. Pipkin Rd. and proceed to the Public Parking Area I-4 East / West ‚Äì Exit 25 Proceed South on County Line Road and turn East (left) on West Pipkin Rd. and proceed to the Public Parking Area. I-4 East / West ‚Äì Exit 27 Polk County Parkway ‚Äì Hwy 570 East (Toll ‚Äì 50 cents) Exit South (right) onto Waring Rd. exit. Continue South to Pipkin Road and turn West (right) on to Pipkin Rd. Turn West (right) again on W. Pipkin Rd. Pass GEICO and proceed to the Public Parking Area. I-4 East/ West ‚Äì Exit 41 Polk County Parkway ‚Äì Hwy 570 West (Toll ‚Äì $3.00) Take Waring Rd. exit and turn South (left) at the light. Continue South on Waring Rd. to stop light and turn West (right) on Pipkin Road. Pass GEICO and proceed to the Public Parking Area. State Road 60 East / West North on County Line Rd. ‚Äì East (right) on W. Pipkin Rd. and proceed to the Public Parking Area. 2. I plan on attending the Lakeland Pigfest, so where do I park? Once you arrive at the Lakeland Pigfest, the public parking is clearly marketed and FREE of charge , simply follow the signage to available parking and the entry. 3. How much does it cost to attend Pigfest? Admission into Lakeland Pigfest is just $5 per person and kids 12 and younger can enter at no charge with an adult. Once inside the gates, stop by a Pig Bucks booth (located near the¬†entrance and various locations throughout) and exchange your cash for Pig Bucks, the official currency of the Lakeland Pigfest. By purchasing food from competition teams, you are supporting their efforts and local charities.¬†Trust us‚Ä¶the food is worth it! 4. I cannot volunteer or attend, but would like to support the charitable interests Pigfest supports ‚Äì how can I help? Pigfest welcomes members of the community who would like to donate or sponsor this year‚Äôs event and help support the ongoing charitable efforts of our organization. If you or your organization would like to help, please visit our sponsors‚Äô page on this website or contact our sponsorships coordinator, Bob Wabbersen, at sponsorships@lakelandpigfest.org for more information. 5. I am a part of a competition BBQ team and would like to compete ‚Äì what is the process for entering? Pigfest gives returning teams the opportunity to return to each year‚Äôs competition prior to opening entry for new BBQ Teams. ¬†In rare instances, we have a limited number of spots open up to new competition teams.¬†¬†Find the applications located here. 6. I am interested in becoming a certified KCBS BBQ Judge.¬† What is the process for applying? KCBS will offer a Judging School at the Lakeland Pigfest location in Lakeland, FL.¬† You must apply prior to attending this class. ¬†Applications are available here . KCBS teams are known for cooking some of the best barbeque in the world, but it takes a dedicated team of judges to decide which is truly the best-of-the-best. Being a Certified Barbeque Judge (CBJ) means more than just getting to taste award-winning barbeque ‚Äì and deciding which barbeque wins those awards. It‚Äôs about representing and spreading the message of KCBS, which is to promote America‚Äôs cuisine ‚Äì barbeque.¬† To become a CBJ, just attend this class conducted by KCBS. In just four hours, you‚Äôll learn how to grade world-class chicken, pulled pork, ribs and brisket ‚Äì and taste them during the process! By the time you‚Äôre finished, you‚Äôll be ready to sign up for the next competition in your area! And remember: your CBJ fee also includes one year‚Äôs membership to KCBS. It‚Äôs a win-win! Pigfest Dates! We are proud to announce that the 28th Annual Lakeland Pigfest will again be held at the SUN n‚Äô FUN Expo Campus in Lakeland, Florida, on January 24th and January 25th, 2025. Join the Lakeland Pigfest Board of Directors and the over 150 competition barbecue teams for a weekend of good eatin‚Äô, good friends, and good tunes to benefit Lakeland-area charities as we kick off the 28th Annual Lakeland Pigfest! contact pigfest - Lakeland Pigfest Home About Community Map FAQ Entertainment Results 2025 2025 anything butt competition winners 2025 kinder‚Äôs pro division winners 2025 publix backyard division winners 2025 applegate kids-q winners 2024 2024 anything butt, anything butt appetizer, sauce, dessert, and steak winners 2024 kingsford pro division winners 2024 publix backyard division winners 2024 kids-q winners 2023 2023 anything butt, anything butt sides, sauce, dessert, and steak winners 2023 kingsford pro division winners 2023 publix backyard division winners 2023 kids-q winners 2022 2022 anything butt, sauce and dessert winners 2022 kingsford pro division winners 2022 kids-q winners 2022 publix backyard division winners 2020 2020 anything butt, sauce and dessert winners 2020 kingsford professional contest winners 2020 publix backyard division winners 2020 badcock & more kidsQ winners 2019 2019 kingsford professional contest winners 2019 publix backyard division winners 2019 badcock & more kidsQ winners 2018 2018 Kingsford Professional Contest Winners 2018 Publix Backyard Division Winners 2018 Badcock & More KidsQ Winners 2017 2017 Kingsford Professional Contest Winners 2017 Publix Backyard Winners 2017 Badcock & More KidsQ Winners 2016 2016 kingsford professional contest winners 2016 Publix Backyard Results 2015 2015 Kingsford Professional Contest Results 2015 Publix Backyard Results 2015 Side Contest Results Applications Sponsors Contact Donate Menu Menu contact pigfest The continued success of the Lakeland Pigfest is in no small part due to the unwavering support of its organizers. When the seeds for the festival were first planted in 1994, the small group of local businessmen knew that in order to put on a Kansas City Barbecue Society (KCBS) sanctioned event in Lakeland, dedication was a must. Almost 30 years later, the commitment could not be stronger and we welcome you to contact our event coordinators with questions, comments, or suggestions. To e-mail any of the following members, please click on their name. mailing address Lakeland Pigfest P.O. Box 8814 Lakeland, Florida 33806 pigfest executive committee Donovan Tinsley ‚îÇ President Larry Holmes ‚îÇ 1st Vice President Bob Wabbersen ‚îÇ 2nd Vice President Coleen Pizzuti ‚îÇ ¬†Secretary James Previte ‚îÇ Treasurer Bill Tinsley | Immediate Past President email us info@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ General Inquiries to Pigfest sponsors@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ Sponsorships judgingschool@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ Judging School volunteers@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ Volunteer Support prodivision@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ¬† Kingsford Professional Division judges@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ¬†Kingsford Professional Judging backyarddivision@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ¬†Publix Backyard Division kidsq@lakelandpigfest.org ‚îÇ¬†Kids-Q Website or Marketing inquiries can be made to info@lakelandpigfest.org .
